intro: Cyrtandra hians, commonly known as the white-flowered cyrtandra, is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its upright growth habit and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white, tubular flowers that are typically arranged in a terminal inflorescence. Cyrtandra hians thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in some horticultural settings.
